description: 71-year-old male with metastatic squamous cell lung cancer, no actionable driver mutations identified (EGFR/ALK/ROS1/BRAF wild-type, KRAS wild-type). PD-L1 TPS ≥90%. First-line pembrolizumab monotherapy achieved durable response for 22 months, now progressed with new contralateral lung nodules and mediastinal lymphadenopathy. Seeking second-line immunotherapy combinations or novel checkpoint approaches. Former heavy smoker (50 pack-years). COPD on inhalers, no supplemental O2. Mild CKD (eGFR 52). Motivated patient willing to travel for trials.
